intro: Guatteria esmeraldae, commonly known as the Emerald Green Guatteria, is a member of the Soapberry family (Sapindaceae). It is a small evergreen tree or shrub native to the cloud forests of Central America, particularly in Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its dense, glossy dark green foliage and produces small, fragrant white flowers. Its fruit is a smooth, green, fleshy drupe that turns yellow when ripe. Guatteria esmeraldae plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
